channel.title: Adding sara sword w/ spec? Help me please
channel.description:
Okay, so i've been editing Allstarscapev2 source for a while now for my server i'm going to make (maybe).
When i started editing was the first time i've ever done anything with Java. I'm used to Actionscript 2 in Flash.
So i want to add a sara sword w. working spec, but i'm not sure how to. Once i see the codes i'd use, i would understand them, but i don't know about the "rules" of Java. I think i'd need the sara sword ID, the special gfx id, the emote id for the reg atk. And then i think i edit the item.cfg file and add bonuses to the sword. but, theres lots of items that are like "NON EXISTING ITEM", im not sure why. Is it possible to add a new weapon?
Help please. =).

item.description:
@dadancinman wrote:

Thanks for all the help so far , but… I NEED TO KNOW WHERE TO PUT THE EMOTE ID FOR THE SARA SWORD REG ATK, AND HOW TO ADD SPEC FOR IT AND WHERE!!! Please and thanks <sorry for caps,.

Help? PLease!.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 12, 2008, 09:28:24 PM[/size][hr]anybody[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 12, 2008, 10:27:25 PM[/size][hr]please help. :o thanks.

item.source: Adding sara sword w/ spec? Help me please

item.title: Adding sara sword w/ spec? Help me please
item.dc:creator: @d_man103456 d man103456
item.description:
@d_man103456 wrote:

To make an item untradeble you just simply go into client.java and search for

    public int untradable

and you should see something similar to this

[code] public int untradable[] = { 6384}; //Put all untradable items here

public boolean isUntradable(int item) {
    for (int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) {
        if (untradable[i] == item) {
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}[/code]

where it says — public int untradable[] = { 6384}; simply add a comma and the item code.
EXAMPLE: public int untradeable[] = { 6384, 4444};

Read full topic

item.title: Adding sara sword w/ spec? Help me please
item.dc:creator: @dadancinman dadancinman
item.description:
@dadancinman wrote:

[quote=“iI Bl1tz U Ii, post:5, topic:219770”]Remember, After you save the file you have to Compile it, It should say this
Its Compiling, W8 N00b (Doesn’t matter what it says here)
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Finished Compiling.
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

okay 1. You don’t have to compile for .cfg files

  1. i always compile

  2. not all compilers say that -.-

Oh and sean, how would i make it unsellable? And could sum one point me to a tutorial for adding specs?

Oh and, don’t i need to put some where the attack emote for the sword? where would i put that, and what kinda code would i use for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding sara sword w/ spec? Help me please
item.dc:creator: @sean2 sean_
item.description:
@sean2 wrote:

to elaborate on what zac said (no offense zac)… go to ur item.cfg file and add this to the bottom

item = 15351	Saradomin Sword	Powerful		50000000	50000000	50000000	100	100	100	100	100	100	100	100	100	100	100	100

u can change the numbers to w/e u want…the first three are the buy/sell/alch prices. the 10 after that are the att/def bonuses. and the last two are the str/pray bonus

as for the specs… im not a good coder like that =\

Read full topic
item.source: Adding sara sword w/ spec? Help me please

item.title: Adding sara sword w/ spec? Help me please
item.dc:creator: @dadancinman dadancinman
item.description:
@dadancinman wrote:

ztr zac:

Usually if an item appears as “NON EXISTING” or “Invalid”, this is becuase the item is not present in the servers Item.cfg. To fix this add the to Item.cfg. As for adding the spec, There are many tutorials out there. Im sure someone will post a link.

Well, i was trying to change bonuses for Icons (Attacker icon, etc) in item.cfg but when i tested it in my server it didn’t work, and then i went to try make a shop with icons, and it gave me errors in the compiler. Then i discovered all the icons were “no existant”, but they were in the item.cfg.

So im not sure.

Read full topic
